Package com.api.hub.configuration.ai

Class AgentRegister

java.lang.Object
com.api.hub.configuration.ai.AgentRegister
All Implemented Interfaces:
org.springframework.beans.factory.config.BeanPostProcessor
@Component public class AgentRegister extends Object implements org.springframework.beans.factory.config.BeanPostProcessor
Spring BeanPostProcessor implementation responsible for registering AI agents within the AI-Agent framework.

When a Spring bean implementing the AiAgent marker interface is initialized, this class scans the bean's methods for the Agent annotation. For each annotated method, it creates and configures an AgentDefination instance, which encapsulates metadata and behavior information about the agent method. These agent definitions are then organized into named pools for logical grouping and later retrieval.

This enables dynamic registration and configuration of AI agents based on annotated methods, facilitating modular agent development and management within the framework.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Detect Spring beans implementing the AiAgent interface.
  • Scan such beans for methods annotated with Agent.
  • For each annotated method, create an AgentDefination containing:
  • Agent name (combining bean name and method name)
  • Description, goals, and method reference from the annotation
  • Reference to the bean instance as the agent handler
  • Group agent definitions into pools as defined by the agentPools attribute of the annotation.
  • Provide a static method to retrieve agents by pool name.
See Also:

  • Method Details

    • postProcessAfterInitialization

      public Object postProcessAfterInitialization(Object bean, String beanName) throws org.springframework.beans.BeansException
      Post-processes beans after initialization to detect AI agents and register their agent methods.

      If the given bean implements AiAgent, this method scans all its declared methods for the Agent annotation. For each annotated method, it creates an AgentDefination instance and configures it based on annotation attributes and method references. The agent definitions are then added to one or more pools as specified.

      Specified by:
      postProcessAfterInitialization in interface org.springframework.beans.factory.config.BeanPostProcessor
      Parameters:
      bean - the bean instance created by Spring container
      beanName - the name of the bean in the Spring context
      Returns:
      the original bean instance (unmodified)
      Throws:
      org.springframework.beans.BeansException - in case of any processing errors

    • getAgents

      public static List<AgentDefination> getAgents(String poolName)
      Retrieves the list of AgentDefination instances registered under a given pool name.
      Parameters:
      poolName - the name of the agent pool
      Returns:
      a list of agent definitions associated with the pool, or null if no agents are registered under that pool
